info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 4:57PM CDT until August 18 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, southern Kane.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 453 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving into the area with rain rates exceeding 2 inches per hour. Flooding may begin shortly after the onset of heavy rainfall. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Aurora, West Chicago, Batavia, Geneva, Montgomery, North Aurora, Sugar Grove, Boulder Hill, Elburn, Big Rock and Kaneville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING
